item.title: [Delta] How to add Corporeal Beast [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

This code makes me want to kill children. Lack of conventions, you seriously need to package that Delta shit, instead of hosting it all in the same class, here’s one thing I’ll actually help with, everything else is just, scary.

if(command.startsWith("master") && playerRights >= 2){
            addSkillXP(20000000, 1);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 2);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 3);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 4);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 5);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 6);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 7);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 8);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 9);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 10);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 11);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 12);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 13);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 14);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 15);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 16);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 17);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 18);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 19);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 20);
            addSkillXP(20000000, 21);
sM("Mastering the cheatyness (; Nicee.....");
}

y u no loop?

if(command.startsWith("master") && playerRights >= 2){
    for (int i = 0; i < 21; /*20? forgot*/ i++) {
        addSkillXP(20000000, i);
    }
    sM("Mastering the cheatyness (; Nicee.....");
}

item.title: [Delta] How to add Corporeal Beast [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“mista pnut, post:23, topic:444795”][quote author=MrFun link=topic=547483.msg4081845#msg4081845 date=1345433773]

He doesn’t hit because you haven’t added him into npchandler.java

You’ll need to add something like this:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == true && plr.ProtMelee == false) { //protect magic hitDiff = misc.random(32); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == true){ //protect melee hitDiff = misc.random(46); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == false){ //no protection prayer hitDiff = misc.random(68); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number }

I’m not here to spoonfeed. Find your own animations and GFXs.

I’m not trying to anim or GFX(i think) I’m just trying to make him hit
and plus i added him on my npchandler like all my other npc the part where its like this


					/* 112 */2536, 4780, 2539, 4780, 2540, 4781, 2537, 4782,
					2537, 4782, 2536, 4773, 2539, 4783, 2536, 4784, 2540, 4775,
					/* 1582 */2513, 4777, 2512, 4775, 2514, 4773, 2515, 4775,
					2513, 4772, 2513, 4779, 2515, 4780, 2512, 4781, 2514, 4783,
					2516, 4782,
This is him	-->	              /* 2697*/3051, 3518,

and its seems to work on all the npcs besides him
[/quote]

Remove him from that. No clue what the hell that is.
In your npchandler class search for something like this:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1338) { // dagg rand_npc = misc.random(60); }
Add one for your NPC using it’s ID.
rand_npc is how often the NPC hits 0 would be never and 300+ being often/very often

Now, you’ll add the maxhit.
Search for:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1338) { // dagg hitDiff = misc.random(5); }
hitDiff = 15;//the npc will always hit 15
hitDiff = misc.random(16);//hits between 0 and 15
hitDiff = 15 + misc.random(6);//always hits at least 15, max hit of 20. (15+6-1=20)*

*with misc.random 0 is the first number, so if misc.random(3) the options are 0, 1, & 2.

Lastly, scroll down until you find something that looks like this.

hitDiff = misc.random(2); } } else { hitDiff = 0; } }

Directly above that you’ll have a long line looking similar to this, but it will be different because I’ve added my own NPCs into this.

			if (npcs[NPCID].npcType != 117 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1114 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2687 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 3494 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 117 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 112 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1338 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1610 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1616 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1637 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1624 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1615 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2783 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 941 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1625 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1613 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1264 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1459 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1030 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 87 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 19 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 3 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 4 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 10 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 181 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1267 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 90 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2627 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2630 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2631 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2731 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2741 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2743 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2745 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2746 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1154 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1155 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2591 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2604 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2610) {

Now, add your NPC to this like so

&& npcs[NPCID].npcType != xxxx
That is basically saying, if the NPC is not listed above, the maxhit is 1. So, you’ll want to remove it from that list so that your maxhit will go through. That’s all.[/quote]

the code I game you came from “Public static int worldmap[][] = {”

And thanks

Read full topic

item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

[quote=“MrFun, post:22, topic:444795”][quote author=mista pnut link=topic=547483.msg4081586#msg4081586 date=1345418487]
He doesn’t hit because you haven’t added him into npchandler.java

You’ll need to add something like this:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == true && plr.ProtMelee == false) { //protect magic hitDiff = misc.random(32); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == true){ //protect melee hitDiff = misc.random(46); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == false){ //no protection prayer hitDiff = misc.random(68); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number }

I’m not here to spoonfeed. Find your own animations and GFXs.
[/quote]

I’m not trying to anim or GFX(i think) I’m just trying to make him hit
and plus i added him on my npchandler like all my other npc the part where its like this


					/* 112 */2536, 4780, 2539, 4780, 2540, 4781, 2537, 4782,
					2537, 4782, 2536, 4773, 2539, 4783, 2536, 4784, 2540, 4775,
					/* 1582 */2513, 4777, 2512, 4775, 2514, 4773, 2515, 4775,
					2513, 4772, 2513, 4779, 2515, 4780, 2512, 4781, 2514, 4783,
					2516, 4782,
This is him	-->	              /* 2697*/3051, 3518,

and its seems to work on all the npcs besides him[/quote]

Remove him from that. No clue what the hell that is.
In your npchandler class search for something like this:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1338) { // dagg rand_npc = misc.random(60); }
Add one for your NPC using it’s ID.
rand_npc is how often the NPC hits 0 would be never and 300+ being often/very often

Now, you’ll add the maxhit.
Search for:

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1338) { // dagg hitDiff = misc.random(5); }
hitDiff = 15;//the npc will always hit 15
hitDiff = misc.random(16);//hits between 0 and 15
hitDiff = 15 + misc.random(6);//always hits at least 15, max hit of 20. (15+6-1=20)*

*with misc.random 0 is the first number, so if misc.random(3) the options are 0, 1, & 2.

Lastly, scroll down until you find something that looks like this.

hitDiff = misc.random(2); } } else { hitDiff = 0; } }

Directly above that you’ll have a long line looking similar to this, but it will be different because I’ve added my own NPCs into this.

			if (npcs[NPCID].npcType != 117 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1114 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2687 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 3494 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 117 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 112 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1338 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1610 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1616 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1637 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1624 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1615 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2783 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 941 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1625 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1613 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1264 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1459 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1030 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 87 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 19 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 3 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 4 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 10 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 181 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1267 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 90 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2627 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2630 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2631 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2731 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2741 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2743 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2745 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2746 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1154 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 1155 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2591 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2604 && npcs[NPCID].npcType != 2610) {

Now, add your NPC to this like so

&& npcs[NPCID].npcType != xxxx
That is basically saying, if the NPC is not listed above, the maxhit is 1. So, you’ll want to remove it from that list so that your maxhit will go through. That’s all.

if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == true && plr.ProtMelee == false) { //protect magic hitDiff = misc.random(32); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == true){ //protect melee hitDiff = misc.random(46); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number } if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == xxxx && plr.ProtMage == false && plr.ProtMelee == false){ //no protection prayer hitDiff = misc.random(68); npcs[NPCID].animNumber = xxxx;//xxxx = animation # plr.stillgfx(xxxx, npcs[NPCID].absY, npcs[NPCID].absX);//xxxx = gfx number }

item.title: [Delta] How to add Corporeal Beast [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

[quote=“ictbguud, post:1, topic:444795”][size=18pt]Okay, today I will be showing you how to add Corporeal Beast to your Delta server, pretty easy honestly. But this tutorial does NOT include, making it walk. I think o…o … Okay so let’s get started! (:[/size]

First you’re going to wanna Download the Corporeal Beast’s Model and Ints.

Download link provided here: http://uppit.com/cup1x0njooww/Corporeal_Beast’s_Model_and_Ints.rar

Now after downloading your going to want to open up your Client’s folder and open up the models folder, now add the model into the model folder and click the back button.

Now open up Class5.java (MAKE SURE IT IS NOT class8.java)!

Ctrl+f and search:

Under that you now want to add this code:

if(i == 2697) { // NPC ID you can change this if u like aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Collect original NPC data class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses int changedColors = 1; // Number of model colors changed on the NPC class5.anIntArray76 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray70 = new int[changedColors]; class5.anIntArray76[0] = 0; // Original model color class5.anIntArray70[0] = 0; // Changed model color class5.anIntArray94[0] = 9389; // 28002 class5.aString65 = "Corporal Beast"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = 982; //combat level class5.aByteArray89 = "The mighty lord Armadyls general Kree'arra!".getBytes(); // NPC description }

Now, Save and close.

Now open up your Source’s folder and open up Autospawn.cfg and enter this code at the top or bottom:

spawn = 2697 2644 9539 0 3021 4828 2975 4820 1

Red Numbers = Npc’s ID
Yellow Numbers = Xcoords
Blue Numbers = Ycoords

Now open up Npcdrops.cfg and type this code:

[quote]//Corporeal Beast
npcdrop = 2697 00000 1 300
npcdrop = 2697 00000 1 300
npcdrop = 2697 00000 1 300
npcdrop = 2697 00000 1 300
npcdrop = 2697 00000 1 300
[/quote]

Orange Name = Npc’s Name
Pink Numbers = Npc’s ID
Red Numbers = Item ID You Want It To Drop
Yellow Numbers = How Many Of That Item You Want Dropped
Green Numbers = Drop Rate Of The Item. (300 = Drop’s Every Kill)

Now open up Npc.cfg and at the top enter this:

[quote]npc = 2697 Corporal Beast 982 20000 1
[/quote]

Red Numbers = Npc’s ID
Yellow Name = Npc’s Name
Pink Numbers = Combat Level
Purple Numbers = HP Of That Npc
Blue Numbers = Respawn Rate (1 should spawn it back right when it’s killed)

Now go to Client.java and search a command such as Master, it should look like this when you search it.

if(command.startsWith("master") && playerRights >= 2){ addSkillXP(20000000, 1); addSkillXP(20000000, 2); addSkillXP(20000000, 3); addSkillXP(20000000, 4); addSkillXP(20000000, 5); addSkillXP(20000000, 6); addSkillXP(20000000, 7); addSkillXP(20000000, 8); addSkillXP(20000000, 9); addSkillXP(20000000, 10); addSkillXP(20000000, 11); addSkillXP(20000000, 12); addSkillXP(20000000, 13); addSkillXP(20000000, 14); addSkillXP(20000000, 15); addSkillXP(20000000, 16); addSkillXP(20000000, 17); addSkillXP(20000000, 18); addSkillXP(20000000, 19); addSkillXP(20000000, 20); addSkillXP(20000000, 21); sM("Mastering the cheatyness (; Nicee....."); }

Now under that last }
Add this code:

} if(command.startsWith("corp") && playerRights >= 0 && action < 1){ if (inCombat == true) { sM("You arn't aloud to teleport to Corporeal Beast when your in combat!"); } else { toX = 2644; toY = 9539; sM("Welcome to Corporeal Beast!"); heightLevel = 0; }

[size=36pt]Don’t like commands?

Than do not worry! You can use a portal to teleport you to it![/size]

First of all you will want the portal’s ID.

I’m going to be using Varrock Portal (ID = 13615)

Now open up Client.java (in source folder)

And search:

Under that add this:

“#” = Xcoords.
“$” = Ycoords.
“%” = Portal ID.

Now go search (In client.java):

You should see something like this:

[quote]if(objectID == 1553 && objectX == 3236 && objectY == 3295){
ReplaceObject(3236, 3295, 1553, -1, 0);
}[/quote]

After one of the }
Paste this:

if(objectID == 13615){ toX = 2651; toY = 9529; heightLevel = 0; sM("Welcome to the Corporeal Beast's Lair!"); }

And your done! Hope this helped!

Credits:
30% to sorealx for showing me how to add portal teleporting.
30% to the owner of Corporeal Beast’s Model and Ints.
10% to lankioras for the source that I use it on.
30% to me for taking an hour and a half for typing this all out and sharing it with you guys.

Really hope this helped you all!

Make sure to comment (; ![/quote]

I did all this yet he is not hitting me please help me on what I need to do please

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @wartek wartek
item.description:
@wartek wrote:

[quote=“ictbguud, post:11, topic:444795”][quote author=`SJ_ link=topic=547483.msg4035080#msg4035080 date=1341124867]

I’m getting an error when i want to start my server.

Your server is now online. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2 697 Corporal Beast" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at NPCHandler.loadNPCList(NPCHandler.java:2155) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:568) at server.main(server.java:164)
Can you help me please?
Edit:I fixed it, but now i got another problem , is it normal that the corp beast is litle as fuck?
I mean its as big as my feet …

NumberFormatException is because of bad tabbing. Go and retab everything you added in your spawns.cfg.
[/quote]

Thank you for helping him :).[/quote]
I already figured that out, but thanks for reply and help, another question where can I find the anims for walking,attacking,etc?

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] How to add Corporeal Beast [Delta]
item.dc:creator: @ictbguud ictbguud
item.description:
@ictbguud wrote:

[quote="`SJ_, post:10, topic:444795"][quote author=wartek link=topic=547483.msg4031251#msg4031251 date=1340791874]
I’m getting an error when i want to start my server.

Your server is now online. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2 697 Corporal Beast" at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Unknown Source) at NPCHandler.loadNPCList(NPCHandler.java:2155) at NPCHandler.<init>(NPCHandler.java:568) at server.main(server.java:164)
Can you help me please?
Edit:I fixed it, but now i got another problem , is it normal that the corp beast is litle as fuck?
I mean its as big as my feet …

[/quote]

NumberFormatException is because of bad tabbing. Go and retab everything you added in your spawns.cfg.[/quote]

Thank you for helping him :).

Read full topic
